actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned pursuant to a previous special order. The next meeting is scheduled for 12:00 p.m. on September 23, 2024.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Kiley moved that the House do now adjourn.
The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.

Mr. Mooney asked unanimous consent That, when the House adjourns on Friday, September 20, 2024, it adjourn to meet at noon on Monday, September 23, 2024, for morning-hour debate and 2:00 p.m. for legislative business. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.
Considered by unanimous consent. H. Res. 1470 — "Expanding the jurisdiction of the Task Force on the Attempted Assassination of Donald J. Trump."
Mr. Mooney asked unanimous consent to discharge from committee and consider.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 405
actions-list.actionItem: 0 (Roll no. 439).

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 9106 — "To direct the Director of the United States Secret Service to apply the same standards for determining the number of agents required to protect Presidents, Vice Presidents, and major Presidential and Vice Presidential candidates, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 215

actions-list.actionItem: Considered as unfinished business. H.J. Res. 136 — "Providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the rule submitted by the Environmental Protection Agency relating to "Multi-Pollutant Emissions Standards for Model Years 2027 and Later Light-Duty and Medium-Duty Vehicles"."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 219
On motion to recommit Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 190

actions-list.actionItem: Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 5717 — "To provide that sanctuary jurisdictions that provide benefits to aliens who are present in the United States without lawful status under the immigration laws are ineligible for Federal funds intended to benefit such aliens."

The Chair announced the unfinished business was on motion to recommit H.R. 5717, passage of the bill, if ordered, passage of H.J. Res. 136, and motion to suspend the rules and pass H.R. 9106, as amended, which were debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.

At the conclusion of debate on H.J. Res. 136, the Chair put the question on passage of the joint resolution and by voice vote announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Pallone demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H.J. Res. 136.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 3724, H.R. 4790, H.R. 5179, H.R. 5339, H.R. 5717, H.R. 7909 and H.J. Res. 136. The resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 3724 and H.R. 5717 under a structured rule and H.R. 4790, H.R. 5179, H.R. 5339, H.R. 7909, and H.J. Res. 136 under a closed rule. The resolution provides for one hour of general debate and one motion to recommit on each measure.

Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 1455. H.J. Res. 136 — "Providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the rule submitted by the Environmental Protection Agency relating to "Multi-Pollutant Emissions Standards for Model Years 2027 and Later Light-Duty and Medium-Duty Vehicles"."
The House proceeded with one minute speeches which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 5 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mr. Tonko to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by Dr. John S. Repsold, Mosaic Fellowship, Spokane, Washington.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
